title: Baddesley Clinton Walks

images.title: Des Adams / Baddesley Clinton
images.caption: Baddesley Clinton. Where they filmed some of the Virgin Queen. A fine Tudor building well worth a visit with some magnificent gardens to walk in.

images.title: Kokai / Church at Baddesley Clinton
images.caption: The Mediaeval Church of St. Michael is close to Baddesley Clinton House

images.title: Andy Stephenson / Typical farm animals at Baddesley Clinton
images.caption: Typical farm animals in the grounds. Two goats pose for the camera while a horse grazes in the background.

images.title: David Stowell / Stone seat
images.caption: An interesting stone seat in the grounds of Baddesley Clinton Manor. The three limbs have figures of a fox, a rabbit and a badger, all cautiously watching each other!

images.title: David Stowell / Ferrers-Walker memorial kitchen garden
images.caption: Ferrers-Walker memorial kitchen garden. Henry Ferrers made many additions to Baddesley Clinton in the early 17th century, including starting the tradition of stained glass representing the family's coat of arms. He is also credited with building the great hall.

images.title: David Stowell / Dahlia bed
images.caption: The colourful Dahlia bed in the gardens

description: Enjoy a circular walk through the delightful grounds surrounding this moated manor house near Warwick . In the grounds you will find woodland trails, a lake and a walled garden with flower borders and fruit trees. The walk then continues into the adjacent Hay Wood where there are miles of peaceful woodland trails and pretty bluebells to enjoy. The house itself has a delightful courtyard, with yew trees, lawns and brick paths. Inside you can explore the Tudor Kitchen, the 16th century Great Hall and the library. Both the Grand Union Canal Walk and the Stratford Upon Avon Canal run past the estate so there is scope for continuing your walk along one of these waterways. Also nearby is the lovely Packwood House . This is another National Trust owned property with parkland and gardens to explore. There's a pretty lake, herbaceous borders, wildflower meadows, splendid topiary and a beautiful orchard. Our Lapworth Circular Canal Walk visits both Packwood and Baddesley Clinton with nice waterside stretches along the two canals.
